title: Shooting at Halloween house party leaves three dead and nine injured
text:
Nine people have been taken to hospital and five are said to be in a serious condition, police said

Three people were shot dead at a house party to celebrate Halloween last night, police have said.

At least 12 people were shot and nine taken to hospital after a gunman opened fire at the party in the Los Angeles suburb of Long Beach in California, US.

Witnesses described ‘distressing’ scenes as the victims were treated by emergency workers in front of the house.

Neighbours said gunshots were fired at around 10.45pm local time – around 5.45am in the UK.

The Long Beach Fire Department said the three people killed were all men.

At least five of those taken to hospital were seriously injured.

Witnesses said medics started treating some of those injured in front of the house (Picture: @LBFD)

Neighbours said emergency services arrived at around 10.45pm (Picture: @LBFD)

The frantic work of emergency services was captured in aerial pictures which showed people being treated on the ground outside the home.

The three victims were taken outside where they were declared dead.

Nine others who were injured by gunshots have been taken to hospital and five are said to be in a serious condition, authorities said.

Long Beach 2 dead 7 others shot & taken to hospital. 7th & Ohio a home that may have been hosting a Halloween party. 2 suspects on the lose after the shooting Long Beach PD investigating @KCBSKCALDesk pic.twitter.com/1MdtOKNiXt — stu mundel (@Stu_Mundel) October 30, 2019

Firefighters set up a triage in the front garden alongside a neighbouring nail salon.

Police have not yet said if more than one gunman was involved or if there have been any arrests.

The force urged people to stay away from the area.

This is a breaking story we will be updating.
